content:
Mutek was founded in 2000 by Alain Mongeau.[3] A Mexican edition of MUTEK has taken place in Mexico City since 2003. Annual South American single and/or multi-day events have taken place in Argentina and Chile since 2002 and 2004 respectively. Showcases have occurred in Brazil and Colombia as well.[4][better source needed] In 2005 MUTEK was among the first Western cultural organizations to send a delegation of electronic artists to China.[5][better source needed] In 2014, MUTEK paired with digital arts festival Elektra for the EM15 festival in Montreal.[6]
